summary: This document is a chain of emails between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing how to handle posthumous document requests from Jeffrey Epstein's defense team. The emails center on routing requests under Touhy regulations to the Civil Division and mention the pending nolle prosequi (dismissal) of the criminal case following Epstein's death.

persons.role: Defense Attorney (Partner at Steptoe & Johnson LLP)
persons.context: He is the sender of the initial correspondence attaching document requests from Epstein's defense team to the SDNY, MCC, and FBI.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (US v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 0490) which is being terminated following his death.

events.title: Epstein Defense Team Submits Document Requests
events.description: Epstein's lawyers at Steptoe & Johnson LLP send document requests to the SDNY, MCC, and FBI following Epstein's death.

events.title: SDNY Discusses Nolle Prosequi and Discovery Clawback
events.description: SDNY prosecutors discuss that a proposed order of nolle prosequi (dismissal) is pending and plan to ask for all discovery back once it is entered, terminating the criminal proceeding.

keyFacts: Following Jeffrey Epstein's death, his defense team submitted document requests to the SDNY, MCC, and FBI, which the SDNY determined should be handled by the Civil Division under Touhy regulations.

The SDNY had submitted a proposed order of nolle prosequi (dismissal) for the criminal case US v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 0490, and planned to terminate the proceeding and claw back all discovery once it was entered.
The email chain reveals internal SDNY coordination to assign an AUSA from the Civil Division to handle posthumous requests from Epstein's estate, indicating the administrative aftermath of his death.
